solution_line_template: Before the extra colored pencils, he had {initial_pencils}/{num_containers}=<<{initial_pencils}/{num_containers}={pencils_per_container_initial}>>{pencils_per_container_initial} colored pencils in each container.
With the other colored pencils, he is given he now has {initial_pencils}+{added_pencils}=<<{initial_pencils}+{added_pencils}={total_pencils}>>{total_pencils} colored pencils

If you distribute them evenly each container should have {total_pencils}/{num_containers}=<<{total_pencils}/{num_containers}={pencils_per_container_final}>>{pencils_per_container_final} colored pencils
